com.bmc.arsys.apitransport.connection

Class ApiProxyPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bmc.arsys.apitransport.connection.ApiProxyPool
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ApiProxyPoolI

    public abstract class ApiProxyPool
extends Object
implements ApiProxyPoolI
    This class provides many adjustable parameters to dynamically changing the pool size. It ages-out idle proxy accord to settings.
    idle time
    If the pool currently has more than minProxiesPerServer proxies, excess proxies will be terminated if they have been idle for more than the connectionTimeout. This provides a means of reducing resource consumption when the pool is not being actively used. If the pool becomes more active later, new proxies will be constructed. This parameter can also be changed dynamically using method ProxyManager#adjustConnectionVariables. Using a value of 0 effectively disables idle proxies from ever terminating prior to shut down.

      • deRecodeProxy

        public void deRecodeProxy(ApiProxyI t)

      • get

        public ApiProxyI get(ApiUserContextI context)
              throws ARException
        Return a proxy from the pool. There are three cases: if the pool is not empty, return a proxy from the pool; if the pool is empty and the maximum number of connections have not been made, make a new proxy and return it; otherwise, wait until a proxy has been returned to the pool (making it not empty again) so one can be taken from the pool.
        Specified by:
        get in interface ApiProxyPoolI
        Returns:
        Throws:
        InterruptedException
        ARException

      • put

        Specified by:
